questions.question_text: Which two requirements must be met to allow two routers running EIGRP for Ipv6 to become neighbors? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: C and D are the correct answers
Should A and D I believe

choices.D: The autonomous system numbers must match.
choices.E: The routers must be operating on different subnets. CD
choices.A: Both routers must be configured to use the MTU K value for metric calculations.
choices.B: The peering interface on each router must be set to passive.
choices.C: The EIGRP process must be in no shutdown mode on both routers.

questions.answer_description:
Multiple point-to-point tunnels can saturate the physical link with routing information if the bandwidth is not configured correctly on the tunnel interface.
Reference:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/interface/configuration/15-sy/ir-15-sy-book/ir-impl-tun.html
questions.question_text: After you configure multiple point-to-point tunnels on one interface, you notice that the interface is suffering from saturation. Which action do you take to correct the problem?

choices.B: on a CPE with more than 10 other clients
choices.A: on a dialer interface configured with multilink PPP
choices.D: on a dialer interface configured for QoS queuing
choices.C: on an Ethernet connection between two endpoints

questions.question_text: In which configuration can a PPPoE client operate normally?

discussion.content:
The answer should be C.

The PPPoE client does not support the following: 
-More than ten clients per customer premises equipment (CPE)
-QoS transmission with queueing on the dialer interface
-Multilink PPP (MLP) on dialer interfaces 
... More listed but not relevant to the options

Source:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/bbdsl/configuration/xe-3s/bba-xe-3s-book/bba-pppoe-client-xe.html#GUID-FF823066-1DE6-4613-B933-8484384F51E1
